name: sncld
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cha), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(csn(c1), cfv(ccld, c0)))

stmt.origin: sylan(wcel(c0, cha), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(csn(c1), cfv(ccld, c0)), wcel(c0, ct1))
stmt.pretty: sylan(c0 ∈ Haus, c1 ∈ c2, { c1 } ∈(Clsd ` c0), c0 ∈ Fre)

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cha), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(csn(c1), cfv(ccld, c0)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cha), wcel(c0, ct1))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, ct1), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(csn(c1), cfv(ccld, c0)))
body.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ Haus ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→ { c1 } ∈(Clsd ` c0))
⊣ (c0 ∈ Haus → c0 ∈ Fre)
⊣ ((c0 ∈ Fre ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→ { c1 } ∈(Clsd ` c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cha), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(csn(c1), cfv(ccld, c0)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cha), wcel(c0, ct1))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, ct1), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(csn(c1), cfv(ccld, c0)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ Haus ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→ { c1 } ∈(Clsd ` c0))
⊣ (c0 ∈ Haus → c0 ∈ Fre)
⊣ ((c0 ∈ Fre ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→ { c1 } ∈(Clsd ` c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cha), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(csn(c1), cfv(ccld, c0)))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, ct1), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(csn(c1), cfv(ccld, c0)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, ct1), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(csn(c1), cfv(ccld, c0)))
-| wceq(c2, cuni(c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cha), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(csn(c1), cfv(ccld, c0)))
-| wceq(c2, cuni(c0))

comment: A singleton is closed in a Hausdorff space. (Contributed by NM, 5-Mar-2007.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 24-Aug-2015.)
